communication
Class ClientHandler

java.lang.Object
  communication.ClientHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
communication.ServerInterface, java.lang.Runnable, java.rmi.Remote, logging.Loggable
Direct Known Subclasses:
RMIClientHandler, SocketClientHandler
public abstract class ClientHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable, communication.ServerInterface, logging.Loggable

Overview

The ClientHandler class is an abstract class that handle the communication with the client. Most of its methods are to be overridden in its subclasses, since them define the communication type (i.e. the subclass SocketClientHandler handles the socket communication with the client, while the RMIClientHandler handles the RMI communication with the client).

Responsibilities

This class must give the server the possibility to accomplish the clients' requests and give responses regardless the effective connection method (socket or RMI).
For this reason, it must define the legal requests that the client can perform and must store some information about the server status or notifications.

Collaborators

This class is called very often by the server GUI, so its collaborators are ServerMainWindow and in general by all the classes that needs to communicate with the client regardless the type of communication used.

Version:
1.0
Author:
RAA
